alert.note: Alert for Eastern Douglas County Foothills; South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 12 at 1:39PM PST until February 14 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM MONDAY TO 4 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches with up to 16 inches possible above 4500 ft. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Douglas County Foothills and South Central Oregon Cascades. This includes Highway 138 east of Glide, Highway 230, portions of Highway 62 and portions of Highway 58 including Willamette Pass. This also includes Steamboat, Toketee, Union Creek, Diamond Lake and Crater Lake. * WHEN...From 10 AM Monday to 4 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could reduce visibility over high exposed terrain. The cold wind chills as low as 5 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Most of the snow will fall Monday afternoon into Tuesday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Douglas County Foothills; South Central Oregon Cascades
